Description: Lower body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat style black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a large bowl; interior glazed black with two wide bands in added red lined in white; exterior, from top: black-figure frieze with bull to right (part of head and forelegs remaining with red on shoulder) with incised blob rosettes as filling ornament; wide black bands with added red band lined in white; wild goat frieze (neck, part of head and antlers of one goat grazing to right; part of rump and tail of second goat to right); rosette as filling ornament; ancient drill hole at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 3, pl. 3, no. 22)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.262)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
